title: Please consider reverting Twitch's Ult name back to Spray and Pray
body:
{{champion:29}} 

So [these](https://i.gyazo.com/241ef9c6e80ea3f5a7e805c7d3f22203.png) [surveys](https://i.gyazo.com/84a52a4eace3f0c49f38d354a4b1c00a.png) are coming out lately with what I presume Riot is looking this over with the Assassin/Stealth update about Twitch's ult name. Now I've been playing since before Twitch's VU and even went to the Twitch VU panel at PAX East and I remember the huge outcry towards the change to Twitch's ultimate name to "Rat-ta-tat-tat" (and to a lesser extent, "Expunge" to "Contaminate").  

Years later, it still leaves a bad taste in my mouth to see Rat-ta-tat-tat as the official name. To be honest, it was the only downside to what plenty of people consider one of the better VU's Riot has done. (Aside from us losing of OG Twitch's taunt and joke) Spray and Pray conveys the idea of Twitch's ult (blindly firing into a crowd with autos that can miss) way better than Rat-ta-tat-tat (The sound affect of a clunky machine gun firing, in which only one of Twitch's skins actually has a machine gun.) can ever be.


 And god if Twitch is picked in pro play and I have to hear another announcer butcher Rat-ta-tat-tat on stream I'm just gonna stop watching pro matches.

replies.body:
We have indeed been talking over the last few days about whether we should change the name of Twitch's ult back to 'Spray and Pray' as part of the Pre-Season changes to Twitch. For that discussion we've wanted to gather as much context as we could about how people feel about the two names. Surveying Twitch players after they've finished a game is part of that, as are other things like looking at forum sentiment (both when the change was made and now), talking to some Twitch mains direct etc. 

As well as looking at how the change has been perceived we also wanted to consider why the name was changed in the first place. Talking with the team who worked on Twitch a couple of years back they had a few goals they were looking to accomplish. Those involved concerns about 'Spray and Pray' having some misleading gameplay implications, some thematic connotations (Twitch used to have a somewhat more militaristic vibe that the update moved away from) and a few other smaller points. 

In terms of the survey results they're been closer to neutral than some of us had predicted going in. From what we've seen overall however players who care a lot about the ult's name tend to prefer 'Spray and Pray' noticeably more often though. 'Spray and Pray' is also still really frequently used as a name, sometimes even by players who never played old Twitch. Thematically, while it does have a bit of oddness as a name (wild machine gun firing isn't a perfect fit for how the skill functions) it does still evoke the whole 'rapidly shooting many targets all at once' of Twitch ult pretty well. 

Our overall conclusion is that we should change Twitch's ult back to the name 'Spray and Pray'. We do feel there are some valid concerns about it, but overall think it's a better fit with what people want and expect from Twitch than Rat-ta-ta-tat. Apologies to those who prefer the current name, can definitely understand why even if we don't feel that overall it's the right choice. One thing we are looking into (no promises of success yet, but we're trying) is whether or not we can keep the name 'Rat-ta-tat-tat' purely for Gangster Twitch, given the connection with the Tommy Gun Twitch uses on that skin. That's not something we'd normally want to do, since there's a clarity hit to different ability names on different skins. Given the details of this particular case though we figure it's potentially a good place to make an exception though, try and meet the desires of both groups to at least some degree.
Did that really need 4 full paragraphs?

- Rioter answers with "Yes" or "no"
- Forums go like "OMG GIVE CONTEXT F U"
___
- Rioter gives good long answer
- Forums go like "OMG TL;DR F U"

Need? No. I figured some people, those that have really wanted 'Spray and Pray' back as a name, or those who really like 'Rat-ta-tat-tat', would appreciate the detail though. Seemed worth taking the time to offer some extra context as a result, even if many others might not care about the decision much.
Ignore him, Meddler. He's a salty sandwich.

Any chance you could have a similar talk about Lux' ultimate? 'Final Spark' is just a dull name compared to the old one, even if it translates into being the same. Finales Funkeln stood out, and ended up being changed to a rather generic name instead. Was there any real reason for it, or was it just a worry that people would have trouble pronouncing it?

> [{quoted}](name=Lithillya,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xoI730fL,comment-id=0014000200010000,timestamp=2016-10-13T13:30:28.524+0000)
>
> Any chance you could have a similar talk about Lux' ultimate? 'Final Spark' is just a dull name compared to the old one, even if it translates into being the same. Finales Funkeln stood out, and ended up being changed to a rather generic name instead. Was there any real reason for it, or was it just a worry that people would have trouble pronouncing it?

I agree with this. Finales Funkeln was such a great name. Plus it had the epicness of what you expected from a giant laser beam that cannot be stopped.

As an avid {{champion:29}}  player before and after the changes i think that having both depending on skin is a REALLY nice touch. Im in the i like both names for different reasons camp Spray and Pray because when i first played twitch it really felt like i was spraying and praying lol and that lead to some really cool moments when i would either decimate their whole team or just get cc'd and die because my positioning was pretty bad. And Rat-ta-tat-tat felt cool because it has rat in it its the sound of a gun and it also lead to some cool moments. 
Im hoping that you guys can do both names.
Was 'Sewer Skewers' considered as a name?
This is really cool. But doesn't roll off the tongue like Spray & Pray
You clearly never heard Twitch say it then.
EXPUNGE.

We'd like to stick with the move away from Expunge, given the E no longer expunges the passive's poison, so it directly clashes with the gameplay now. With you expunge is a cool name though certainly.

I understand the reasoning behind the move away from expunge, but I would like to say this: Not a single person I know that plays league calls Twitch's E Contaminate. Most of us, myself included, still call it expunge. In fact, while writing this I had to go back and correct an instance where I used the wrong name. Not only does the name roll off the tongue far better than contaminate does, but as many others have mentioned the name "contaminate" implies applying some new Damage over time effect, not the massive burst of damage that the ability actually is. whereas Expunge implies a sudden exodus of some kind. Which, while still inaccurate to the ability's current function, far more closely matches what actually happens than the current name.

Additionally, an argument can be made that, although Twitch is not expunging his poison, he _is_ expunging his enemy's life. Not exactly a strong argument, but at the very least an amusing one.
I call it contaminate. Now you know someone :P

> not the massive burst of damage

Lol

510 magic dmg vs 290 + 1.5 bonus AD physical never forgetti

But at the same time, contaminate is probably more descriptive of a DoT ability or something, not violently consuming Deadly Venom stacks in a single burst.

I'd rather have the original name if the other option is an equally poor description of the ability.

Like the other replies to this comment, I am also unsure why contaminate is preferred over expunge as no new damage or status effect is given by the ability contaminate. I prefer expunge but will concede that neither really work well. Hopefully we'll be able to come up with a new name for that ability. Maybe something like exterminate (which can play along the fact that he is a rat)?

This is gonna be the new Ryze meme.

Every year, Twitch gets a new name for his abilities.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xoI730fL,comment-id=001400030000,timestamp=2016-10-13T08:23:44.987+0000)
>
> We'd like to stick with the move away from Expunge, given the E no longer expunges the passive's poison, so it directly clashes with the gameplay now. With you expunge is a cool name though certainly.

Expunge always felt as the more accurate name, even now. Twitch doesn't look like he is contaminating you in his animation. He looks like he is ripping the poison out of you. He is just not that "good" at it so he always leaves more than enough behind.

Plus Contaminate doesn't make sense since you are already poisoned and aren't becoming more poisoned.

Also while we are at it we should change Venom Cask to Gift Bad, which while hilariously fits the idea of Twitch giving you bad gifts, also means Poison Bath in German. It seems like the perfect name for the skill.
But the ability has never and still doesn't _Contaminate_.

How about giving Ganster Twitch a unique voice over line where he screams "Rat ta tat tat!" when activating his ult? This way you don't have to change the ability name for one skin and you can still satisfy players that own Ganster Twitch and prefer the current name of his ult.
I don't feel much for this particular decision, but if you set a precedent with Gangster Twitch, more requests will follow (e.g., Kuro an Shiro for Star Guardian Jinx' Q)

So with this....can I have my Finales Funkeln back now?

I understand if not because of languages and such, but that still leaves a bad taste in my mouth as well as Twitch's ultimate being changed...

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xoI730fL,comment-id=0014,timestamp=2016-10-13T06:13:05.914+0000)
>
> We have indeed been talking over the last few days about whether we should change the name of Twitch's ult back to 'Spray and Pray' as part of the Pre-Season changes to Twitch. For that discussion we've wanted to gather as much context as we could about how people feel about the two names. Surveying Twitch players after they've finished a game is part of that, as are other things like looking at forum sentiment (both when the change was made and now), talking to some Twitch mains direct etc. 
> 
> As well as looking at how the change has been perceived we also wanted to consider why the name was changed in the first place. Talking with the team who worked on Twitch a couple of years back they had a few goals they were looking to accomplish. Those involved concerns about 'Spray and Pray' having some misleading gameplay implications, some thematic connotations (Twitch used to have a somewhat more militaristic vibe that the update moved away from) and a few other smaller points. 
> 
> In terms of the survey results they're been closer to neutral than some of us had predicted going in. From what we've seen overall however players who care a lot about the ult's name tend to prefer 'Spray and Pray' noticeably more often though. 'Spray and Pray' is also still really frequently used as a name, sometimes even by players who never played old Twitch. Thematically, while it does have a bit of oddness as a name (wild machine gun firing isn't a perfect fit for how the skill functions) it does still evoke the whole 'rapidly shooting many targets all at once' of Twitch ult pretty well. 
> 
> Our overall conclusion is that we should change Twitch's ult back to the name 'Spray and Pray'. We do feel there are some valid concerns about it, but overall think it's a better fit with what people want and expect from Twitch than Rat-ta-ta-tat. Apologies to those who prefer the current name, can definitely understand why even if we don't feel that overall it's the right choice. One thing we are looking into (no promises of success yet, but we're trying) is whether or not we can keep the name 'Rat-ta-tat-tat' purely for Gangster Twitch, given the connection with the Tommy Gun Twitch uses on that skin. That's not something we'd normally want to do, since there's a clarity hit to different ability names on different skins. Given the details of this particular case though we figure it's potentially a good place to make an exception though, try and meet the desires of both groups to at least some degree.

Spray & Pray sounds SO MUCH MORE IN CHARACTER for the quirky/crazy rat. Rat-ta-tat-tat doesn't invoke any emotions and has no inherent meaning. We've all seen some action movies so we know the meaning and emotions associated with the former. It also makes sense given the way his ult. works. 

I don't know why it was changed initially but if it was due to the religious connotation of pray, I think that's overblown. I'm not religious but just like people say "oh my god," they can use the term pray in secular contexts ("I pray that X doesn't happen!" etc.).

On a separate note, I think seeing basically no Twitch at Worlds shows that his 6.19 nerf was unnecessary.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xoI730fL,comment-id=0014,timestamp=2016-10-13T06:13:05.914+0000)

That's not something we'd normally want to do, since there's a clarity hit to different ability names on different skins. Given the details of this particular case though we figure it's potentially a good place to make an exception though, try and meet the desires of both groups to at least some degree.

Throwing this out there because maybe there is a better option...

Spray and Pray is a good classic name, although it may not fit with the current mechanics.

What about "Sewer Skewers" ... given that Twitch already has the VO line "Sewer Skewers for everyone" and then it works pretty well IMO

> as part of the Pre-Season changes to Twitch. 

Explain.

I keep asking in the Assassin/invis update threads, but they've been extremely scant on details. What's happening to mah boy Twitch?

They're reworking how stealth works, and splitting it into "invisibility" and "camouflage."

There probably won't be serious changes to any other parts of Twitch's Kit.

It's probably just in reference to changes they're making to champions as a whole. If you recall last preseason, it wasn't just the marksman roster update; all sorts of champions got changes during that time period. I wouldn't expect Twitch's changes to be much more than number tweaking at the most.
Remember my super cool Rat-ta-tat-tat? My Rat-ta-tat-tat is different from regular Rat-ta-tat-tats. Itâs like my Rat-ta-tat-tat is in the top percentage of Rat-ta-tat-tats.
SHUT UP JOEY I'M FIGHTING THE ELITE FOUR RIGHT NOW!
I prefer sewer skewers myself, since he says that in game.

> [{quoted}](name=Furaffinity Net,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xoI730fL,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-10-12T03:46:08.217+0000)
> 
> (and to a lesser extent, "Expunge" to "Contaminate").  
> 




Well to be fair,that one is understandable considering that expunge was originally named like this because it removed the poison from his victims,which he doesn't do anymore.

I honestly didn't even realize that they changed Expunge, until like a couple of weeks ago when i got Twitch in ARAM and was reading the tooltips while waiting for something to happen because i was bored.
while they do that can we name sion's ult to "0 followup"? It fits what happens during games ! :d
And change his passive to "Die Again But Meaninglessly"
How about something more elegant like "RAAAAAAAAAAAGH!"
**_COWWWAAAAAAAAARRDS!!!!!!_**

I really think it should be called sewer skewers tbh


but rat-a-tat-tat is just horrible
They did it for the pun.
we know but that pun was cancerous

>And god if Twitch is picked in pro play and I have to hear another announcer butcher Rat-ta-tat-tat on stream I'm just gonna stop watching pro matches.

This is why Montie, Doa and Papa Smithy are the best casters. The Korean casters still refuse to call it Rat-ta-tat-tat on stream and always call it spray and pray.

I personally really liked the name Expunge.  It just calls to mind Twitch ripping the poison stacks out of the target, doing damage, while contaminate implies he's like infecting someone with a new ability or something.  I know that expunge probably isn't the best name since it doesn't actually remove the poison stacks, but I still like to call it that because Contaminate just seems dumb to me.
Fester would probably work well

> [{quoted}](name=Furaffinity Net,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xoI730fL,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-10-12T03:46:08.217+0000)

I still call it expunge and spray an pray.
While we're at it, can we rename {{champion:30}} 's Q to "Taste the Rainbow"?
wait it's not?*googles* OMG IT'S NOT and his E isn't expunge, wat when did this happen and why does his ult have such a shitty name.
Sorc boots have only 15 magic pen.
Please Riot, switch it.
Aw, I'm gonna miss the pun.
